result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas P. Leber

records.addlTxt:
2:08 PM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Thomas P. Leber in court.  Attorney Philip Edward Marry in court for Thomas P. Leber. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Marry advises the Court that he was just recently retained and is requesting an adjournment so he may request/review the discovery and discuss resolution with the State. Attorney Marry is also requesting a DA pretrial be scheduled.
DA pretrial conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 530221,
Payable Number: 349848,
Receipt Number: 22R 027586,
Amount: $20.00

08:47 AM  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Thomas P. Leber, appeared.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. DE states he was unable to hire an attorney since March as he was unemployed. DE now has employment and is requesting an adjournment so he may retain an attorney. Discussion held. Court will grant the DE one more adjournment to retain counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Fr: Court re: rotation. Copy mailed to DE by clerk.

Minutes:  Judge Dreyfus acting for Branch 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Deft requests add'l time to obtain counsel.  No objection by the State.  Status set for 8/19/22 @ 8:45am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Continued Posted
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Pamela P, Morelli's Deli 7506 7th Avenue, No violent contact w/ Idell S,  *Not To Discuss Case w/ Idell S, MD

240PM    State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:50 am.  Jury selection scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $650  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  ts
and witness list filed by the State  kmk
